bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ minMatR1 =(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s2 ‚àà(Base `(s0[Mat]s1))‚Ü¶(s3 ‚àà s0, s4 ‚àà s0 ‚Ü¶(s5 ‚àà s0, s6 ‚àà s0 ‚Ü¶ if(s5 = s3, if(s6 = s4,(1r ` s1),(0 ` s1)),(s5[s2]s6))))))
comment: Define the matrices whose determinants are the minors of a square matrix. In contrast to the standard definition of minors, a row is replaced by 0's and one 1 instead of deleting the column and row (e.g., definition in [Lang] p. 515). By this, the determinant of such a matrix is equal to the minor determined in the standard way (as determinant of a submatrix, see ~ df-subma - note that the matrix is transposed compared with the submatrix defined in ~ df-subma , but this does not matter because the determinants are the same, see ~ mdettpos ). Such matrices are used in the definition of an adjunct of a square matrix, see ~ df-madu . (Contributed by AV, 27-Dec-2018.)
